# What to expect from this talk? {background-image="https://posit.co/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/conf23-hero2-static.png" background-size=contain background-position="bottom" background-opacity=0.2}

An interactive workshop where you’ll learn to build dynamic R dashboards with Shiny and Quarto, enabling teams to visualize, explore, and share data effectively.

```
- 📊 Learn to create interactive dashboards 
- 🛠️ Hands-on techniques for filtering, sorting, visualizing data, and uncovering trends
- 🌍 Explore advanced features like tools and workflows useful for academic research groups, and business teams.

```

**`R-Ladies Rome`** has grown into a **`widely recognized community`**. 

Here are the filled-in statistics for R-Ladies Rome:
Since January 2023, we’ve welcomed over **1.7K members** on Meetup, gained **3K+ RSVPs**, and successfully organized **40+ events**.

::: {#fig-members layout-ncol=2}

![Members-August25](images/rladiesrome-members-august25.png){#fig-members}

![Members by Event](images/rladiesrome-members-by-event.png){#fig-event}

R-Ladies Rome Members Growth (left) and Members by Event (right)
:::

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: false
library(meetupr)
rladies_rome <- get_events("rladies-rome")
rladies_rome_members <- meetupr::get_members("rladies-rome")
saveRDS(rladies_rome, "data/rladies_rome.rds")
saveRDS(rladies_rome_members, "data/rladies_rome_members.rds")
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: false
library(tidyverse)
rladies_rome <- readRDS("data/rladies_rome.rds")
rladies_rome_members <- readRDS("data/rladies_rome_members.rds")
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: false
events_rsvp <- rladies_rome %>%
  select(id,time,going)%>%
  mutate(time = as.Date(time,origin="1970-01-01"),
         time_id=row_number(time)) %>%
  arrange(time_id)%>%
  group_by(time_id,time) %>%
  reframe(going = sum(going))%>%
  mutate(tot_going = cumsum(going))


tot_members <- rladies_rome_members%>%
  mutate(created = as.Date(created,origin="1970-01-01"))%>%
  group_by(created)%>%
  reframe(members=n())%>%
  mutate(tot=cumsum(members))
```

```{r}
#| layout-ncol: 2
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| eval: false
events_rsvp%>%
  ggplot(aes(x = time, y = tot_going)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_smooth(color = "purple", se = F)+
  scale_x_date(date_labels = "%b-%y",date_breaks="3 months") +
  labs(title = "R-Ladies Rome Events RSVP",
       subtitle = "Cumulative number of reservations",
       x = "Time(month-year)",
       y = "Number of Attendees",
  caption = "DataSource: {meetupr} R-package | Graphics: Federica Gazzelloni") +
  theme_minimal()+
    theme(plot.title = element_text(size=18,face="bold",hjust=0.5),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(size=14,face="bold",hjust=0.5),
        plot.caption = element_text(size=10,face="italic"))

  
tot_members%>%
  ggplot(aes(x = created,y=tot)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_smooth(color = "purple", se = F)+
  scale_x_date(date_labels = "%b-%y",date_breaks="3 months") +
  labs(title = "R-Ladies Rome Membership Registration Growth",
       subtitle = "Cumulative number of members",
       x = "Time(month-year)",
       y = "Number of Members",
       caption = "DataSource: {meetupr} R-package | Graphics: Federica Gazzelloni") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size=18,face="bold",hjust=0.5),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(size=14,face="bold",hjust=0.5),
        plot.caption = element_text(size=10,face="italic"))
```

# R-Ladies Rome presents: {.smaller background-image="https://i.giphy.com/media/v1.Y2lkPTc5MGI3NjExc3F5N2FwNGZnZ2s1b2hlY2ppbXU0bmIwa2JhN3U1MDNzOTcyYXdtZCZlcD12MV9pbnRlcm5hbF9naWZfYnlfaWQmY3Q9Zw/ySvZaRKnzCdvG/giphy.gif" background-opacity=0.2}

We are thrilled to have with us [Derek Sollberger](https://www.linkedin.com/in/derek-sollberger/), a lecturer at the Center for Statistics and Machine Learning (CSML), where he teaches Data Science, AI Methods, and Bayesian Analysis.

Derek is a Posit Certified Tidyverse Instructor with extensive experience leading R programming workshops and serving as a data analysis consultant for research projects in pedagogy. His passion lies in making complex statistical tools approachable and useful for real-world applications.

Today, he’ll guide us through building interactive Quarto dashboards—powerful tools for academic teams, business groups, and anyone who needs clear, interactive data communication.

Please join me in giving a warm welcome to Derek Sollberger! 🌟
